title: Set up swing pricing
body: To set up swing pricing:

title: Set up swing pricing
body: Choose the fund in the NAV status view and click to open the Fund wizard.

title: Set up swing pricing
body: Go to the Swing pricing tab and choose Apply swing pricing.

title: Set up swing pricing
body: Fill in the fields:

title: Set up swing pricing
body: Official NAV

title: Set up swing pricing
body: A setting to choose how swing adjustment is used in your fund. Choose one of the options:

title: Set up swing pricing
body: Swung NAV - Swing adjustment is included in official NAV. The logic of handling swing adjustment is shown in the table.

title: Set up swing pricing
body: Unswung NAV – Swing adjustment is not included in official NAV. The logic of handling swing adjustment is shown in the table.

title: Set up swing pricing
body: Swing factor

title: Set up swing pricing
body: Swing factor is used for adjusting the unit price.

title: Set up swing pricing
body: For swinging up – The percentage to adjust the unit price if the net inflow of the fund exceeds the threshold.

title: Set up swing pricing
body: For swinging down – The percentage to adjust the unit price if the net outflow of the fund exceeds the threshold.

title: Set up swing pricing
body: Thresholds

title: Set up swing pricing
body: Swing thresholds are the net inflow or net outflow of the fund that triggers the adjustment to the NAV. You can set a threshold in fund currency or as a percentage of the fund's total net asset value on the NAV date.

title: Set up swing pricing
body: For swinging up – Net inflow that triggers swinging up.

title: Set up swing pricing
body: For swinging down – Net outflow that triggers swinging down.

title: Calculate swing adjustment
body: Swing adjustment is calculated automatically when you calculate NAV. Depending on your settings, it can be included in NAV or calculated separately and not included in the NAV you publish. To view the NAV and Unswung NAV/Swung NAV, open the NAV window, Share classes tab.

title: Calculate swing adjustment
body: In FA Back, NAV and Unswung NAV/Swung NAV are shown in the Security window, Market data info tab.

title: Calculate swing adjustment
body: Close 4 field shows NAV in the fund’s base currency depending on swing pricing settings for the fund:

title: Calculate swing adjustment
body: Unswung NAV, if you choose swung NAV as official NAV.

title: Calculate swing adjustment
body: Swung NAV, if you choose unswung NAV as official NAV.

title: Fund reporting data
body: FA Fund management provides you with fund performance-related data that you can use to produce fund factsheets and reports.:

title: Fund reporting data
body: Portfolio content grouped by asset classes and types, showing the market value, share of total and share of parent.

title: Fund reporting data
body: Share class performance, showing TWR, Alpha, Beta, Tracking error, Vol ann, Information ratio, SRRI.

title: Fund reporting data
body: Fund performance, showing TWR, Alpha, Beta, Tracking error, Vol ann, Information ratio, Turnover.

title: Fund reporting data
body: The data is generated regularly acording to the schedule you set up for the fund. When the data is calculated, you can preview and accept it.

title: Fund reporting data
body: To create reports based on the generated data, you need to build a report template. To learn more, see the Reporting section in FA Developer guide.

title: Generate fund reporting data
body: To generate fund reporting data:

title: Generate fund reporting data
body: Set the schedule for calculation the reporting data. To do this, choose the fund in the NAV status view and click to open the Fund wizard. Go to the Fund reporting tab, enable fund reporting and define the schedule. For the field details, see Create a fund.

title: Generate fund reporting data
body: Calculate the reporting data (make sure your fund is in the "Pending" status). You can mass-calculate the data or start the calculations one by one from the side panel in the Fund reporting view.

title: Generate fund reporting data
body: View and check the reporting data. After the calculation is completed, you can preview the data by clicking the fund in the list. For details about the fugures, see Fund reporting data in the Reporting data window.

title: Generate fund reporting data
body: If you notice any mistake in the underlying data that caused incorrect calculation, make the necessary fixes and click Recalculate.

title: Generate fund reporting data
body: If you calculated the reporting data on the wrong date, for example, due to an incorrect schedule, you can delete the calculation data from the system. Double-click the fund in the list and click Delete calculation.

title: Generate fund reporting data
body: Accept the calculation if the data is correct (click Accept).

title: Follow the fund reporting statuses
body: You can track the reporting data calculation status in the Fund reporting view and see if you need to calculate the reporting data today.

title: Follow the fund reporting statuses
body: Fund reporting can have the following statuses:

title: Follow the fund reporting statuses
body: No schedule

title: Follow the fund reporting statuses
body: The calculation schedule is missing in the fund settings.

title: Follow the fund reporting statuses
body: No action

title: Follow the fund reporting statuses
body: No calculation or acceptance needs to be carried out today. All calculations are scheduled for the future.

title: Follow the fund reporting statuses
body: Pending

title: Follow the fund reporting statuses
body: Reporting data needs to be calculated today. If you didn’t calculate the reporting data for the previous scheduled days, you need to calculate and accept these first to be able to calculate the current day’s reporting data.

title: Follow the fund reporting statuses
body: Calculated

title: Follow the fund reporting statuses
body: Reporting data was already calculated, and you can accept it.

title: Follow the fund reporting statuses
body: Accepted

title: Follow the fund reporting statuses
body: Reporting data was accepted today. The next calculation date is in the future.

title: Fund reporting data in the Reporting data window
body: Reporting data window shows the reporting data you calculated. The date in the top-right corner shows the latest calculation date. You can choose a previous date to view the history.

title: KPI tabs
body: KPI tabs

title: KPI tabs
body: KPI tabs show fund portfolio analyzed as a whole and by share class. The indicators are:

title: KPI tabs
body: For the fund portfolio: TWR, Alpha, Beta, Tracking error, Vol ann, Information ratio, Turnover.

title: KPI tabs
body: For the share classes: TWR, Alpha, Beta, Tracking error, Vol ann, Information ratio, SRRI.

title: KPI tabs
body: To learn more about these indicators, see Analytics+ in the FA Back reference.

title: Holdings tab
body: Holdings tab

title: Holdings tab
body: The Holdings tab shows the fund portfolio content, with Market value and Share of total specified for each position.

title: Allocation: Asset classes tab
body: Allocation: Asset classes tab

title: Allocation: Asset classes tab
body: The tab shows fund portfolio analyzed by asset type and asset class for all allocation groups.

title: Performance tab
body: Performance tab

title: Performance tab
body: The Performance tab shows the fund portfolio performance since the fund inception as a graph.

title: Set up data sources
body: Reconciliation data is uploaded in FA Operations in a file. You can have multiple data sources for reconciliation, for example, if you reconcile positions and cash accounts, or if you receive position information from different custodians.

title: Set up data sources
body: To make external data available in FA Operations, you need to complete the following steps:

title: Set up data sources
body: You can set up reconciliation to ignore all or certain positions that are present in an FA portfolio but are missing in the external data. This can be useful, for example, if you have several custodians, or if you have positions in certain securities that you always want to skip. For details, in Skip extra positions in FA in FA User guide.

title: Fetch reconciliation file in FA
body: To fetch reconciliation data to FA system, you have the following options, depending on the custodian and the data they provide:

title: Fetch reconciliation file in FA
body: Use FA standard integrations. Currently, only DNB Bank and custody connection works with FA Operations out of the box. For details, see Bank and custody connections.

title: Fetch reconciliation file in FA
body: Upload the file yourself. To do this, you need to consider the following:

title: Fetch reconciliation file in FA
body: File format. If the files you receive from your counterparty are in one of the supported formats, FA system reads them as is. If the file format is unsupported, you need to create a mapping. Supported formats are:

title: Fetch reconciliation file in FA
body: MT535

title: Fetch reconciliation file in FA
body: FA reconciliation file format (see Create a reconciliation file).

title: Fetch reconciliation file in FA
body: File upload. To import the data in FA, you need to upload it in the respective FA folder manually or build a Camel route that fetches the file automatically.

title: Fetch reconciliation file in FA
body: For details about file mapping and file upload, see Import custom CSV files to FA.

title: Fetch reconciliation file in FA
body: If you already use the reconciliation feature in FA Back, you can use your existing integration. Make sure it delivers files to one of the standard file locations {{back.writable.dir}}/reconciliation/standard/ or {{back.writable.dir}}/reconciliation/settlementDate/.

title: Set up the data source in FA Operations
body: To set up the data source:

title: Set up the data source in FA Operations
body: Open the Data sources view in FA Operations and click Add data source.

title: Set up the data source in FA Operations
body: Fill in the fields and define the data fetching options:

title: Set up the data source in FA Operations
body: Data source name

title: Set up the data source in FA Operations
body: The name of the data source. The data source name is visible in the Reconciliation overview.

title: Set up the data source in FA Operations
body: Data source code

title: Set up the data source in FA Operations
body: The code used to identify the data source. The data source code must match the name of the FA folder where the reconciliation file is uploaded. For example, if your reconciliation folder is .../nordea, the code must be "nordea". If you want to switch from carrying out reconciliation in FA Back from FA Operations, enter "default" as the data source code.

title: Set up the data source in FA Operations
body: Match portfolios by

title: Set up the data source in FA Operations
body: The portfolio property used to match portfolios from FA with the external data source. Choose one of the options: Short name, External ID, Name, Book entry.

title: Set up the data source in FA Operations
body: Match securities by

title: Set up the data source in FA Operations
body: The security property used to match securities from FA with the external data source. Choose one of the options depending on the identifiers you use: ISIN code, Security code, Trade code, Update code 1-3, Name.

title: Set up the data source in FA Operations
body: Data delivery schedule

title: Set up the data source in FA Operations
body: The schedule for fetching the external data to FA Operations. Choose the parameters in the fileds or enter the Cron expression in the advanced mode.

title: Set up the data source in FA Operations
body: Use settled balances

title: Set up the data source in FA Operations
body: Compare only settled account balances.

title: Set up the data source in FA Operations
body: Include subportfolios

title: Set up the data source in FA Operations
body: Include positions and cash accounts from subportfolios in the reconciliation.

title: Set up the data source in FA Operations
body: Reconcile items not in the source data

title: Set up the data source in FA Operations
body: Identify mismatches if FA positions are missing in the external reconciliation file. If you receive position information from different custodians, turn off this setting to skip the positions missing in the custodian's file.

title: Set up the data source in FA Operations
body: Date adjustment for data delivery

title: Set up the data source in FA Operations
body: The delay in receiving the reconciliation data. For example, if the reconciliation file received today contains the data for the previous day, set the date adjustment as "1". If the file is received on the same day, set the date adjustment as "0".

title: Set up the data source in FA Operations
body: Time zone

title: Set up the data source in FA Operations
body: Time zone used in the data delivery schedule.

title: Set up the data source in FA Operations
body: Holiday calendar

title: Set up the data source in FA Operations
body: A holiday calendar to take into account in the data delivery schedule, for example, a weekend calendar with Saturday/Sunday weekends. The holiday calendar is used to calculate the dates for upcoming reconciliations and notify the users if the data is missing. The list of available holiday calendars is configured in FA Back (see Preference - Securities).

title: Set up the data source in FA Operations
body: Click Save.

title: Set up the data source in FA Operations
body: After you set up the data source, it is shown in the Reconciliation overview, Upcoming reconciliations. You can view the reconciliation items when FA Operations receives external data.

title: View reconciliations
body: You can view reconciled positions and cash accounts in the Reconciliation overview:

title: View reconciliations
body: Assigned to me – The summary of reconciliation items assigned to you.

title: View reconciliations
body: Open reconciliations – The list of open reconciliations and summary of all reconciliation items.

title: View reconciliations
body: Upcoming reconciliations – Upcoming reconciliation data that is going to be received by the system according to the schedule.

title: Open reconciliations and view items
body: You can view all open items or the list of items per reconciliation. Use filters, and then sort the content by clicking on column titles. You can save the view you created to open it again later (click ). To manage saved views, click .

title: Open reconciliations and view items
body: For the column descriptions, see Reconciliation item properties.

title: Open reconciliations and view items
body: To view a reconciliation item, click . For the field descriptions, see Reconciliation item properties.

title: Reconciliation item properties
body: You can see the reconciliation item properties in the list of items and in the item details pane that opens on the right.

title: Reconciliation information
body: Reconciliation information includes the details of the reconciliation process:

title: Reconciliation information
body: Type

title: Reconciliation information
body: The type of the reconciliation item: position or cash account.

title: Reconciliation information
body: Status

title: Reconciliation information
body: The reconciliation result:

title: Reconciliation information
body: Match – The data in the source and in the system are the same.

title: Reconciliation information
body: Mismatch – The data in the source differs from the data in the system: the item is missing in the source or in the system or one of the amounts doesn't match.

title: Reconciliation information
body: Fixed – The reconciliation item was fixed by correcting the system value or marked as solved.

title: Reconciliation information
body: Not processed – The item reconciliation is in progress.

title: Reconciliation information
body: Errors

title: Reconciliation information
body: The mismatch details. The list of errors: Missing source data, Missing system data, Mismatch in amount, Mismatch in market trade amount in security currency, Mismatch in market trade amount in portfolio currency, Mismatch in purchase trade amount in security currency, Mismatch in purchase trade amount in portfolio currency.

title: Reconciliation information
body: Assignee

title: Reconciliation information
body: The assignee of the mismatch.

title: Reconciliation information
body: Comment

title: Reconciliation information
body: Comment on the mismatch.

title: Position or cash account details
body: Position and cash account details show the system information about portfolios, securities, and transactions related to the item in the FA system.

title: Position or cash account details
body: Account

title: Position or cash account details
body: Account information for cash balance items. Account details include Source account ID and the details of the matching account in the FA system: System account ID, System account number, System account number 2 (secondary), System account name and Balance.

title: Position or cash account details
body: The item details show all accounts with the matching number found in the FA system. To open the account portfolio in FA Back, click .

title: Position or cash account details
body: Portfolio

title: Position or cash account details
body: The portfolio that contains the position or cash account in the FA system. Portfolio details include Source portfolio ID and the details of the matching portfolio in the FA system: System portfolio ID, System portfolio external IDs, System portfolio name, Short name, Book entry.

title: Position or cash account details
body: If a cash account is used in multiple portfolios in the FA system, you can view the list of portfolios in the item details. The amounts from all portfolios are summed up.

title: Position or cash account details
body: To open the portfolio in FA Back, open the item details and click in the System portfolios section.

title: Position or cash account details
body: Security

title: Position or cash account details
body: The security of the portfolio position in the FA system. Security details include Source security ID and the details of the matching security in the FA system: System security code, System security ISIN, System security name, Trade code, Update codes.

title: Position or cash account details
body: Transactions

title: Position or cash account details
body: Five latest transactions for the reconciliation item based on transaction or settlement date, depending on the configuration (see Set up data sources).

title: Values
body: You can view the reconciled position or cash account values:

title: Values
body: Position: amount, market trade amount in security currency, market trade amount in portfolio currency, purchase trade amount in security currency, purchase trade amount in portfolio currency.

title: Values
body: Cash account: amount (account balance).

title: Values
body: FA Operations shows the following information about the reconciled values:

title: Values
body: System value

title: Values
body: Position amount or account balance in the system.

title: Values
body: Source value

title: Values
body: Position amount or account balance in the external source.

title: Values
body: Difference

title: Values
body: The difference between the source and system value (amount).

title: Values
body: Difference (%)

title: Values
body: The difference between the source and system in percent.

title: About FA Advisor
body: FA Advisor app provides advisors with tools for managing customer-related tasks for existing customers and onboarding new customers.

title: About FA Advisor
body: You can use FA Advisor to do the following:

title: About FA Advisor
body: View and edit customer information. You can see a list of all customers and select an individual customer to view their details.

title: About FA Advisor
body: Manage customer-related notes and documents.

title: About FA Advisor
body: View and manage tasks related to a customer. For example, tasks can be reminders to call the customer at a specific time.

title: About FA Advisor
body: Onboard new customers.

title: About FA Advisor
body: View a customer's investments in FA Client Portal with access to the same view as the customer but without the ability to make modifications.

title: Work with customers
body: In FA Advisor, you can see an overview of all of your customers and select individual customers from the list to see more detailed information about them.

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: The following information is available as columns or fields in FA Advisor:

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: Customer ID

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: A unique ID defined for a customer in FA Back. The customer ID separates a customer from other customers (the system does not allow more than one customer with the same customer ID). Customer ID cannot be edited in FA Advisor. You can edit it in FA Back (Contact ID in Contact window).

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: External ID

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: The customer’s ID in an external system, for example, identity number or social security number. The external ID can be used to set up client authentication in FA.

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: Customer type

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: Contact type specified in FA Back. Customer type cannot be edited in FA Advisor. You can edit it in FA Back (Contact window, Type field).

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: Name

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: The name of the customer.

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: Status

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: The status of the customer record in the system. Customer status cannot be edited in FA Advisor. You can edit it in FA Back (Contact window).

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: Representatives

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: Advisor or asset manager who represents the customer. Representatives cannot be edited in FA Advisor. You can edit the representatives in FA Back (Representatives tab in Contact window).

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: Classification

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: The trading classification of the customer, for example, professional or non-professional. Classification cannot be edited in FA Advisor. You can edit it in FA Back (Contact window).

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: Juridical form

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: The juridical form of the customer, for example, private person or company. Juridical form cannot be edited in FA Advisor. You can edit it in FA Back (Contact window).

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: Language

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: The language to produce reports for the customer. If no language is selected, the reports are printed out in Finnish. Language cannot be edited in FA Advisor. You can edit it in FA Back (Contact window).

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: Nationality

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: The nationality of the customer. Nationality cannot be edited in FA Advisor. You can edit it in FA Back (Contact window).

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: Taxation country

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: The taxation country of the customer. Taxation country cannot be edited in FA Advisor. You can edit it in FA Back (Contact window).

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: Tags

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: Tags assigned to the customer in the system. Tags are used, for example, to set up access to customer portfolios, manage trade orders, or produce reports. Tags cannot be edited in FA Advisor. You can edit them in FA Back (Contact window).

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: Phone numbers 1 and 2

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: The customer's phone numbers.

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: Email

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: The email address of the customer.

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: Address (Address 1, Address 2, Postal code, City, Country)

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: The customer’s address information.

title: View and edit customer information
body: The Customers view provides an overview of all of your customers as a list. From this view, you can access the details of individual customers as well as open their FA Client Portal profile.

title: View all your customers as a list
body: To see all your customers in a list, open the Customers view. You can search and filter this list and choose to show or hide certain columns, giving you control of the amount of information shown. The Customers view allows you to do the following:

title: View all your customers as a list
body: Show or hide columns. Click Columns and toggle the switches next to each column.

title: View all your customers as a list
body: Filter the list. Click Filters and choose the filtering options.

title: View all your customers as a list
body: Save a view with selected filters and columns. Click Save view. You can set the view as the default view if needed. To open a previously saved view, click Select view and choose a view from the dropdown menu. To see all saved views and edit them, click .

title: View all your customers as a list
body: Export the search results.You can print the list of customer information or export it as a CSV file by clicking the Export button.

title: View all your customers as a list
body: SCREENSHOT OF CUSTOMERS VIEW

title: View customer details
body: To open Customer details, click in the Actions column. The Customer details view allows you to do the following:

title: View customer details
body: View and edit customer information. Click Edit to make changes to the customer's information. See Customer information in FA Advisor for more field information.

title: View customer details
body: View the customer's representatives and representees. To view the customer's representatives, click Represented by, and to view their representees, click Represents. You can see the representative or representee names and the possible tags assigned to them. The tags indicate their relationship with the customer and what permissions they have. To view a representative's or representee's details in FA Advisor, click on the name or on on the right side of the name. You can only edit the representatives or representees in FA Back (Representatives tab in Contact window).

title: View customer details
body: View the customer's investments as a pie chart or a table in the Investments section. You can see each portfolio's name, ID, and total value next to the chart. The chart only shows active portfolios. If the customer has more than 10 portfolios, only 10 are displayed in the pie chart with the smallest portfolios grouped. Portfolios with less than 5% of the total value are also grouped in the pie chart.

title: View customer details
body: View tasks related to the customer in the Current tasks section. For each task, you can see the status, type, creator, and due date. You can also create new tasks by clicking Add task.

title: View customer details
body: SCREENSHOT OF CUSTOMER DETAILS

title: Access FA Client Portal
body: To access a view-only version of a customer's FA Client Portal profile, click ICON in the Actions column. You cannot make changes to the customer's FA Client Portal in this version.

title: View and manage notes and documents
body: The Notes section in Customer details allows you to view and modify notes, background information, and documents related to the customer.

title: View and edit customer info
body: You can view and edit text in the Customer info tab. Use the Edit button to modify the notes.

title: View and manage documents
body: You can see documents uploaded for the customer in the Documents tab of the Notes section. The documents are grouped by document category (see Preference - Tags to configure document categories in FA Back).

title: View and manage documents
body: To delete or download documents to your device, select the desired documents and click the Delete or Download button.

title: View and manage documents
body: To add documents, click Upload and choose the document category and signing status. You can upload multiple documents at the same time, and the category and signing status is applied to all of them. To make the documents visible to the customer in the FA Client Portal, enable the Show in FA Client Portal option.

title: View and manage documents
body: To edit the document category, signing status, or availability in FA Client Portal, click in the Actions column.

title: View and manage documents
body: SCREENSHOT OF DOCUMENTS TAB

title: View and manage documents
body: The following columns are shown for each document:

title: View and manage documents
body: Group

title: View and manage documents
body: The category of the document, for example, agreement or investment plan. Document categories are configured in FA Back (Preference, Document tags).

title: View and manage documents
body: Document name

title: View and manage documents
body: The name of the document and its file extension, for example, PDF or XLSX.

title: View and manage documents
body: Uploaded by

title: View and manage documents
body: The username of the user who uploaded the document.

title: View and manage documents
body: Upload date

title: View and manage documents
body: The upload date and time of the document.

title: View and manage documents
body: Signing status

title: View and manage documents
body: The signing status of the document, for example, pending or expired. Document signing tags are configured in FA Back (Preference, Document tags). To modify the signing status of a document, the document signing tag needs to be assigned in FA Back (see Managing documents).

title: View and manage documents
body: FA Client Portal

title: View and manage documents
body: The availability of the document in FA Client Portal. To make a document available in the FA Client Portal, it needs to be assigned the "Online" tag in FA Back (see Managing documents).

title: View and manage meeting notes
body: You can see a list of meeting notes in the Meeting notes tab of the Notes section. To view a meeting note, click in the Actions column.

title: View and manage meeting notes
body: To create a new meeting note, click Add meeting note. To delete or download meeting notes to your device as TXT files, select the desired meeting notes and click the Delete or Download button.

title: View and manage meeting notes
body: The following columns are shown for meeting notes:

title: View and manage meeting notes
body: Meeting note name

title: View and manage meeting notes
body: The name of the meeting note.

title: View and manage meeting notes
body: Meeting date

title: View and manage meeting notes
body: The date of the meeting.

title: View and manage meeting notes
body: Author

title: View and manage meeting notes
body: The user who added the meeting note.

title: View and manage meeting notes
body: Modified date

title: View and manage meeting notes
body: The date when the meeting note was modified.

title: View and manage meeting notes
body: Last modified by

title: View and manage meeting notes
body: The user who last modified the meeting note.

title: Add other tabs
body: The Notes section also allows you to add other tabs for your convenience. To create a new tab, use the + Add tab button and enter a name for it in the Note name field. You can then add your notes in the text editor.

title: User access
body: Follow the instructions below to set up access to FA Client Portal:

title: User access
body: Access for end users - Create a user and specify contacts and portfolios the user can access.

title: User access
body: Impersonation mode for troubleshooting - Set up view-only access to client information for advisors, support service, and so on.

title: Access for end users
body: FA Client Portal provides end clients with access to investment information. The user can access:

title: Access for end users
body: Their own portfolios and subportfolios.

title: Access for end users
body: Portfolios and subportfolios of the contacts the user represents – for example, if the user represents their child or a company they work for. A representative can switch between the contacts in FA Client Portal by clicking .

title: Access for end users
body: To provide access to FA Client Portal, you need to:

title: Access for end users
body: Add a new user as described in Managing users in FA Admin guide. Assign the user a role or roles with the following rights in FA Admin Console: FA Client Portal/ ROLE_CLIENT_ACCESS and FA Back/ ROLE_CLIENT_PORTAL. Contact FA customer services if you can't see the listed roles.

title: Access for end users
body: Set up the user’s access to client information stored in FA Back:

title: Access for end users
body: To let the user access their own investment information, make sure the user's contact is specified as a primary contact for the portfolio (see Contacts) and link this contact to the user in FA Admin console (to do this, follow the steps in Link a contact to the user).

title: Access for end users
body: To let a representative access the linked contacts’ information in FA Client Portal, add the user as the contact’s representative in the Contact window, Representatives tab.

title: Impersonation mode for troubleshooting
body: Impersonation mode for troubleshooting

title: Impersonation mode for troubleshooting
body: View-only mode lets advisors and support service specialists access the same view as the client sees, without being able to make any modifications. To access client accounts in FA Client Portal view-only:

title: Impersonation mode for troubleshooting
body: Assign the user a role or roles with the following rights in FA Admin Console: FA Client Portal/ ROLE_IMPERSONATE and FA Back/ ROLE_CLIENT_PORTAL. This will enable impersonation mode in FA Client Portal, and enable launching it from FA Back. Contact FA customer services if you can't see the listed roles.

title: Impersonation mode for troubleshooting
body: View FA Client Portal for a contact in the impersonate mode:

title: Impersonation mode for troubleshooting
body: In FA Back, right-click the contact in the Overview and choose "Impersonate in Client Portal".

title: Impersonation mode for troubleshooting
body: FA Client Portal opens in a new tab in your browser.

title: Enable features for users
body: You can enable or restrict various features for the user in FA Client Portal. The following sections describe how to hide subportfolios, make documents available, enable trading, enable fund switching, enable canceling trade orders, enable deposits and withdrawals, and enable monthly investments and monthly savings.

title: Hide subportfolios
body: You can hide subportfolios from the user in FA Client Portal. To hide subportfolios from the Client Portal, assign the "Client Portal: Hide sub portfolio" tag to the subportfolio in FA Back (Portfolio window, Basic info tab).

title: Hide subportfolios
body: Hidden subportfolios are removed from the portfolio selector, but all figures are still aggregated into the parent portfolio. For more information on portfolio summaries in FA Client Portal, see Overview.

title: Make documents available
body: You can choose which documents are available to the user in FA Client Portal.

title: Make documents available
body: To make a security prospectus available to the user in FA Client Portal, add the link to it in FA Back (Security window, URL field).

title: Make documents available
body: To make a security KIID available to the user in FA Client Portal, add the link to it in FA Back (Security window, URL 2 field).

title: Make documents available
body: To make documents available in FA Client Portal, upload them in FA Back and save them with the "Online" tag. To make documents related to specific securities available to the FA Client Portal user, upload them in the Security window, Documents tab, and add the "Online" tag to them. The documents are then listed below the prospectus and KIID in FA Client Portal.

title: Make documents available
body: For more information on documents in FA Client Portal, see Documents view.

title: Enable trading and switching fund positions
body: You can choose which portfolios and securities the user can trade with in FA Client Portal.

title: Enable trading and switching fund positions
body: To enable trading for a portfolio, add the "Client Portal: Trade" tag to it in FA Back (Portfolio window, Basic info tab). The user can only trade with portfolios that have this tag. For more information on trading in FA Client Portal, see Trading view.

title: Enable trading and switching fund positions
body: To enable buying and selling for a security, add the "Tradeable" tag to it in FA Back (Security window, Other tags field). The user can only trade securities with this tag. For more information on buying and selling in FA Client Portal, see Holdings view.

title: Enable trading and switching fund positions
body: To enable trading in units and trade amount, add the "Trade type: Buy units, Sell units, Buy trade amount, Sell trade amount" tags to a security in FA Back (Security window, Basic info tab).

title: Enable trading and switching fund positions
body: To enable the user to switch a fund position to another fund, add the "Tradeable" and "Switchable" tags to the security in FA Back (Security window, Other tags field). For more information on switching fund position in FA Client Portal, see Holdings view.

title: Restrict securities available for trading
body: You can restrict the trading of securities to only those in groups that are linked to the user's portfolio. This means even if all securities within a portfolio have trading enabled, the user can only trade securities that are part of groups you want to allow trading for.

title: Restrict securities available for trading
body: To restrict trading in FA Client Portal to specific securities only, do the following:

title: Restrict securities available for trading
body: Create a security group with the group code prefix "CP" in FA Back. For example, you can create a group with the code "CP_ TRADABLE". For details on how to create security groups, see Groups view.

title: Restrict securities available for trading
body: Link the security group to the user's portfolio in Portfolio window, Security groups tab in FA Back (see Security groups).

title: Restrict securities available for trading
body: Add the "Tradeable" tag to all securities in the group in FA Back (Security window, Other tags field).

title: Enable canceling trade orders
body: You can allow the user to cancel trade orders. To enable the user to cancel trade orders with Open or Accepted status, add the "Client portal: Cancel orders" tag to the portfolio in FA Back (Portfolio window, Basic info tab). For more information on trade orders in FA Client Portal, see Orders view.

title: Enable deposits and withdrawals
body: To set up deposits and withdrawals for the user, do the following:

title: Enable deposits and withdrawals
body: Add the "Client portal: Deposit" and "Client portal: Withdraw" tags to the user's portfolio in FA Back (Portfolio window, Basic info tab).

title: Enable deposits and withdrawals
body: Mark portfolio accounts to use for deposits and withdrawals in FA Client Portal. To do this, open the Portfolio window, Accounts tab in FA Back, and set the following properties for the accounts:

title: Enable deposits and withdrawals
body: Portfolio cash accounts: set the account category to "Internal".

title: Enable deposits and withdrawals
body: Accounts to deposit funds from: set the account category to "External".

title: Enable deposits and withdrawals
body: Accounts to withdraw funds to: set the account category to "External".

title: Enable deposits and withdrawals
body: If you define multiple external accounts in the user's portfolio, FA Client Portal shows the Deposit from and Withdraw to fields in the Deposit and Withdrawal windows, where the user can choose the external account to use. For more information on deposits and withdrawals in FA Client Portal, see Deposits and withdrawals.

title: Enable monthly investments and monthly savings
body: To enable monthly investments for the user:

title: Enable monthly investments and monthly savings
body: Follow the Set up monthly investments instructions in FA Admin guide to define the trade order generation details.

title: Enable monthly investments and monthly savings
body: Add the "Client portal: Monthly investments" tag to the client's portfolio in FA Back (Portfolio window, Basic info tab).

title: Enable monthly investments and monthly savings
body: To enable monthly savings for the user, add the "Client portal: Monthly savings" tag to the client's portfolio in FA Back (Portfolio window, Basic info tab).

title: Enable monthly investments and monthly savings
body: The user can only set up investment or savings plans for portfolios with the required tag. For more information on monthly investments and monthly savings in FA Client Portal, see Monthly investments in FA Client Portal and Monthly savings in FA Client Portal.

title: Scheduling
body: You can configure FA processes to run at specific times. The scheduling is done with Cron expressions.

title: Create, edit and remove schedules
body: To create and manage schedules, open Tools → Administer → Scheduled functions in the top menu. After selecting a scheduled process, you can see the Cron schedule specified for it. This means a regular execution time has been set for the process.

title: Create, edit and remove schedules
body: To add a new schedule:

title: Create, edit and remove schedules
body: Click the Add button and fill in the fields:

title: Create, edit and remove schedules
body: Cron schedule

title: Create, edit and remove schedules
body: The process schedule specified using Cron syntax (see Cron schedules). The next execution time is shown when a valid Cron schedule is entered.

title: Create, edit and remove schedules
body: Configuration

title: Create, edit and remove schedules
body: The configuration used for the schedule.

title: Create, edit and remove schedules
body: Saved views

title: Create, edit and remove schedules
body: The saved view, if it’s relevant for the process you are scheduling. The saved view can be e.g. saved transaction view if you are scheduling a functionality that runs against a list of transactions.

title: Create, edit and remove schedules
body: Click Save to save the schedules. Alternatively, you can click Remove to delete a schedule.

title: Create, edit and remove schedules
body: Click the Run button to test your configurations. The functionality is run with the configuration set and saved view you specified.

title: Cron schedules
body: The schedules are specified in the Cron syntax. The basic principles are:

title: Cron schedules
body: The schedules are specified in the following order, with space separating each component:

title: Cron schedules
body: Seconds

title: Cron schedules
body: Minutes

title: Cron schedules
body: Hours

title: Cron schedules
body: Day-of-month

title: Cron schedules
body: Month

title: Cron schedules
body: Day-of-week

title: Cron schedules
body: Year (optional)

title: Cron schedules
body: Asterisk ( * ) can be used to specify any value (for example, * as the Day-of-month component indicates that the schedule is run every day of the month).

title: Cron schedules
body: Question mark (?) can be used in day-of-month and day-of-week fields to specify “no specific value”.

title: Cron schedules
body: Some examples of different kinds of schedules:

title: Cron schedules
body: Daily at 15:00:

title: Cron schedules
body: On the first second of the first minute of the 15th hour, every day of month and every month, regardless of the day-of-week

title: Cron schedules
body: Every Friday at 12:30:

title: Cron schedules
body: Every weekday (Monday through Friday) at 08:10:20

title: Cron schedules
body: 20 10 08 ? * MON-FRI

title: Cron schedules
body: On the first day of every month at 21:00

title: FA Advisor user accesses
body: To set up user access to FA Advisor and give a user access to customer data, do the following:

title: FA Advisor user accesses
body: Give a user access to the FA Advisor app by assigning them the correct user role in FA Admin Console, User management view. If you do not have such a role available in the User management view, ask FA to create one for you.

title: FA Advisor user accesses
body: In the FA Admin Console, User management view, link the user to a contact (see Link a contact to the user).

title: FA Advisor user accesses
body: In FA Back, add the contact you linked to in step two as a representative for the contacts they represent in the Contact window, Representatives tab (see Contact window).

title: Set up access to customer investments in Client Portal
body: A user can access a view-only version of a customer's FA Client Portal in the Customers view. To give a user access, assign the correct role to them. See Assign user roles for detailed instructions.

title: Access for employees
body: To manage the user’s access to client information stored in FA, set up the limited visibility feature. For example, you can let advisors view only the portfolios they are responsible for.

title: Access for employees
body: Limited visibility can be set up:

title: Access for employees
body: For each user by linking the user to the clients they are allowed to access.

title: Access for employees
body: For several users - for example, employees of a company branch. In this case, all users who belong to the branch have access to the data associated with the clients of this branch. Employees of another branch don’t have access to this data. When onboarding a new employee, linking the user to a branch automatically sets up the needed access rights.

title: Access for employees
body: Limited visibility affects the following views and windows:

title: Access for employees
body: The Overview, Customers and Contacts, Portfolios, Transactions, Trade orders, Positions, Market prices and Analytics+ views show only contacts and portfolios available to the user under their limited visibility settings.

title: Access for employees
body: The Groups include only the contacts and portfolios available to the user under their limited visibility settings.

title: Access for employees
body: The Document management view shows only contacts and portfolios, transactions, and trade orders available to the user under their limited visibility settings.

title: Access for employees
body: The Bookkeeping view shows only postings available to the user under their limited visibility settings.

title: Access for employees
body: The Rebalance view shows all rebalances conducted by the user or other users who have the same role(s). These include rebalances on the portfolios hidden from the user under their limited visibility settings. The user can manage all the model portfolios available for them according to their user role.

title: Access for employees
body: The Tasks view shows all tasks in the My tasks, My completed tasks, Tasks assigned to me and Tasks created by me lists. When creating a new task, the Assignee and Owner fields in the Task window feature all users who have at least one common role with the logged-in user.

title: Access for employees
body: The Report window shows only the Generate reports tab.

title: Access for employees
body: Other views aren’t affected by the limited visibility settings. You need to make sure that the user roles assigned to the user don’t allow them to access these views.

title: Install FA Client Portal
body: You can install FA Client Portal from Optional packages:

title: Install FA Client Portal
body: Install FA Client Portal in FA Back. Go to Tools → Administer → Install optional packages. In the Other packages section, choose FA Client Portal and click Install.

title: Install FA Client Portal
body: If you intend to use FA Client Portal impersonation feature, go to Tools → Administer → FA Client Portal → Configurations → Impersonation in FA Back. Enter the intended URL of the FA Client Portal, for example, https://myportal.com.

title: Install FA Client Portal
body: Provide access to FA Client Portal. To do this, follow the steps in User access.

title: Install FA Client Portal
body: Contact FA customer service to set up test and production URLs for FA Client Portal.

title: Install FA Client Portal
body: You can have multiple instances of FA Client Portal installed (for example, with different logos and branding). For this, contact FA customer service.

title: User management view
body: The User management view allows you to manage FA platform users and their access rights to applications.

title: User management view
body: <screenshot>

title: Search for users and save the views
body: You can search for the users with filters and sort the search results by clicking on the column titles. For the column descriptions, see User details and account information. You can save the view you created to open it again later (click ). To manage saved views, click .

title: Search for users and save the views
body: To download the user list in the XLXS file, click Export.

title: Search for users and save the views
body: To view and edit user information, click a user in the list – the User details pane opens.

title: Add a user
body: To create a user account:

title: Add a user
body: Click Add user at the top-right corner and fill in the user information:

title: Add a user
body: The User ID used as a username at login and Email (required fields).

title: Add a user
body: Linked contact to set up access to client data or access to FA Front access with the external identity provider.

title: Add a user
body: Other fields if needed. See User details and account information for details.

title: Add a user
body: Click Edit user roles in the User details pane and choose which apps your user can access and with what roles.

title: Add a user
body: To access an app, a user needs a role for it – a user without any roles can't access any application.

title: Add a user
body: Let the user know about their credentials and how to get a password.

title: Add a user
body: Send them the user ID – FA platform doesn't send this information automatically.

title: Add a user
body: Instruct the user to request a password reset link by clicking Forgot password on the login page.

title: Deactivate a user
body: If a user doesn't need to access the platform anymore, we recommend deactivating their account rather than deleting it – this maintains the user's history while preventing them from accessing FA.

title: Deactivate a user
body: To change the status for multiple users, choose the users in the list and click . To change the status for one user, click in the User details pane. You can see the user's status in the list of users:

title: Deactivate a user
body: Active – The user can log in to the FA platform.

title: Deactivate a user
body: Inactive – The user can't log in to the FA platform.

title: Delete a user
body: Deleting a user removes all user information from the system. A deleted user can’t log in. If you just want to disable a user and prevent them from logging in, consider deactivating the user instead of deleting the account. To delete a user, click in the User details pane.

title: Assign user roles
body: The Roles block in the User details pane shows the roles assigned to the user. Roles determine:

title: Assign user roles
body: The app the user can access. To access an app, the user needs at least one role within that app. For example, if a user has a right in FA Back, the user is allowed to access FA Back.

title: Assign user roles
body: The access rights within the app. For example, FA Back roles determine access rights through permission and FA Front roles determine access rights through the views defined for the role.

title: Assign user roles
body: To add or remove the user’s roles, click Edit user roles at the top of the User details pane.

title: Manage authentication
body: You can manage user authentication using the following options:

title: Password reset
body: You can force the user to reset their password on next login. To force a password reset for multiple users, choose the users in the list and click . To force password reset for a selected user, click in the User details pane, choose Force password reset on next login and save the changes.

title: Two-factor authentication
body: Two-factor authentication is a login option that requires entering a verification code in addition to the basic credentials (user ID and password). You can check two-factor authentication status in the User details pane:

title: Two-factor authentication
body: Disabled – Two-factor authentication is turned off.

title: Two-factor authentication
body: Enabled – Two-factor authentication is turned on. The user has logged in and completed the mobile authenticator setup.

title: Two-factor authentication
body: Pending – Two-factor authentication is turned on. You chose “Enable two-factor authentication on next login”, but the user didn’t yet log in to complete the setup.

title: Two-factor authentication
body: To manage two-factor authentication, use the buttons (available depending on the two-factor authentication status):

title: Two-factor authentication
body: Enable two-factor authentication

title: Two-factor authentication
body: Enable two-factor authentication on the next login for the user.

title: Two-factor authentication
body: Cancel two-factor authentication

title: Two-factor authentication
body: Cancel two-factor authentication request that is pending.

title: Two-factor authentication
body: Disable two-factor authentication

title: Two-factor authentication
body: Disable two-factor authentication for the user.

title: Brute force detection
body: FA Platform uses brute force detection to identify attempts to guess a user’s password. Brute force detection temporarily disables the user's account after a certain number and frequency of login failures. The user account is disabled for one minute if:

title: Brute force detection
body: The user enters incorrect credentials twice within a second. This means that someone tries to guess the password programmatically.

title: Brute force detection
body: The user fails to enter correct credentials 5 times. After the account is disabled, every unsuccessful attempt increases the lock by one minute, up to one hour.

title: Brute force detection
body: To check if a user account is disabled by the brute force detection, open the User details pane and go to the Brute force detection section. It includes the following information:

title: Brute force detection
body: Status

title: Brute force detection
body: Brute force detection status of the user account: Blocked (deactivated by brute force detection), or Unblocked (active). A user blocked by brute force detection has to wait for up to 1 hour (depending on the number of unsuccessful login attempts) for the account to be unblocked.

title: Brute force detection
body: Total login attempts

title: Brute force detection
body: The number of failed login attempts.

title: Brute force detection
body: Last attempt

title: Brute force detection
body: The date and time of the last login attempt.

title: Brute force detection
body: IP address

title: Brute force detection
body: The IP address from which the last login attempt was made.

title: Brute force detection
body: To activate a blocked user account, choose Unblock and activate. Once unblocked, your user can log in again without waiting for the system to unblock the user after a certain time.

title: User details and account information
body: The list of users and the User details pane on the right show the following information:

title: User account information
body: User ID (required)

title: User account information
body: A unique user ID for logging in to FA and log the user's activities.

title: User account information
body: Email (required)

title: User account information
body: The user’s email to send a password reset link to the user, if the user clicks Forgot password on the login page.

title: User account information
body: First name, Last name

title: User account information
body: The user’s first and last name.

title: User account information
body: Linked contact

title: User account information
body: The corresponding contact in FA Back. Linked contact is needed to:

title: User account information
body: Grant access only to certain customers and portfolios (see the Set up limited visibility for one user and Set up limited visibility for many users sections in the FA Admin guide).

title: User account information
body: Allow online end users to view their own investments in FA Front. A user that has a linked contact has access to the investment information associated with this contact.

title: User account information
body: Linked contact external ID

title: User account information
body: The user’s external ID received from the external identity provider when the user logs in to FA Front. External ID is used to find a matching contact for the user. If you see this field, this means that FA failed to link a contact to the user. For example, there is no contact with such an ID or there are several contacts with this ID stored in FA. In this case, you can add a contact manually in the Linked contact field.

title: User account information
body: Status

title: User account information
body: The user account status: active (the user can log in to FA) or inactive (the user can't log in to the system). See Assign user roles for details.

title: Sessions
body: The Sessions block shows a list of currently active sessions for the user. For example, the same user might have logged in with different browsers, having multiple sessions open at the same time. The list shows:

title: Sessions
body: Application

title: Sessions
body: The apps where the user is logged in within the session. For example, the user might have FA Back and FA Front open in different tabs in the same browser, accessing both applications with a single login and a single session.

title: Sessions
body: Last access

title: Sessions
body: The date and time the user accessed an app within the session. If the user accesses only one app, this shows the time they logged in, or if your user accesses multiple apps, this shows the time the user last opened a new app.

title: Sessions
body: IP address

title: Sessions
body: Shows the IP address the user is logged in from.

title: Sessions
body: You can log the user out of all sessions by clicking Log out user from all sessions. The user will be able to use FA for a short time until their authentication expires, then they will get a "communication problem" and will be taken to the login page.

title: Last logins
body: The Last logins block shows date and time of the five last user logins.

title: FA Format for importing TWR
body: # Code Required Name Description

title: FA Format for importing TWR
body: 1 pd.endDate Yes End date The end date of the period for which the TWR values are valid. The format is YYYY-MM-dd.

title: FA Format for importing TWR
body: 2 pd.twr Yes TWR TWR over the period. Use a dot as a decimal separator, for example: 0.00995.

title: FA Format for importing TWR
body: 3 pd.twrFx No TWR (fx) TWR (fx) over the period. Use a dot as a decimal separator, for example: 0.00995. The default value is 0.

title: FA Format for importing TWR
body: 4 pd.twrGross No TWR Gross TWR Gross over the period. Use a dot as a decimal separator, for example: 0.00995. The default value is 0.

title: FA Format for importing TWR
body: 5 pd.marketValueEnd Yes Market value Market value. Use a dot as a decimal separator, for example: 0.00995.

title: FA Format for importing TWR
body: 6 pd.cashflow No Net cashflow Net cashflow over the period. Use a dot as a decimal separator, for example: 0.00995. The default value is 0.

title: FA Format for importing TWR
body: 7 pd.currency No Currency The return currency. Enter the currency code. By default, portfolio currency is used.

title: FA Format for importing TWR
body: 8 pd.identifier Yes Porfolio ID Portfolio ID of the portfolio analysed (see the description of the pd.scope field).

title: FA Format for importing TWR
body: 9 pd.scope No Scope The scope of analysis. Currently, only one option is available: PORTFOLIO – import TWR values for a certain portfolio. The default value is "portfolio".

title: FA Format for importing TWR
body: 10 pd.groupingCode Yes Code Identifier of the item used for grouping the data (the grouping is defined in the pd.grouping field). For a portfolio, specify portfolio ID. For a security or security type, specify the code.

title: FA Format for importing TWR
body: 11 pd.grouping Yes Grouping Grouping used for the analysis. For example, you can upload the data grouped by portfolio, security, or security type. For the full list of grouping options, see Analytics+ grouping options in FA Developer guide.

title: FA Format for importing securities
body: # Code Required Name Description

title: FA Format for importing securities
body: 1 s.securityCode Yes Security code Code used to identify the security in the system.

title: FA Format for importing securities
body: 2 s.tradeCode No Trade code Trading code

title: FA Format for importing securities
body: 3 s.updateCode1 No Update code 1 Update code 1 (e.g. Bloomberg code, Reuters code, SIX code, etc.)

title: FA Format for importing securities
body: 4 s.updateCode2 No Update code 2 Update code 2 (e.g. Bloomberg code, Reuters code, SIX code, etc.)

title: FA Format for importing securities
body: 5 s.updateCode3 No Update code 3 Update code 3 (e.g. Bloomberg code, Reuters code, SIX code, etc.)

title: FA Format for importing securities
body: 6 s.isinCode No ISIN code ISIN code

title: FA Format for importing securities
body: 7 s.name Yes Name Security name

title: FA Format for importing securities
body: 8 s.market No Market Not used, use "Market place" (no. 15) or "Settlement place" (no. 55)

title: FA Format for importing securities
body: 9 s.type Yes Type Security type, define with security type's code (configured in the system)

title: FA Format for importing securities
body: 10 s.currency Yes Currency Currency of the security, define with the currency code. Currency is a mandatory field for all other type of securities except for security type "Currency".

title: FA Format for importing securities
body: 11 s.description No Description Description for the security

title: FA Format for importing securities
body: 12 s.url No URL URL

title: FA Format for importing securities
body: 13 s.url2 No URL 2 Secondary URL

title: FA Format for importing securities
body: 14 s.country No Country Country code (configured in the system)

title: FA Format for importing securities
body: 15 s.exchange No Market place Market place code (configured in the system)

title: FA Format for importing securities
body: 16 s.classType No Class 1 Describes a classification 1 for the security with a code. Code/name values for classifications are defined in the system.

title: FA Format for importing securities
body: 17 s.issuer No Issuer Issuer of the security (use contact ID of the issuer saved in the system). If no contact is found, the issuer value is saved as text in the "Issuer description" field instead.

title: FA Format for importing securities
body: 18 s.underlySecurity No Linked security Define with the security code of the linked security. The linked security must exist in the system. Linked security is used e.g. with options and other derivatives to link the security to the underlying instrument.

title: FA Format for importing securities
body: 19 s.blockSize No Block size Number, describing, how many units is one trading block.

title: FA Format for importing securities
body: 20 s.rating No Rating Rating of the security such as AAA

title: FA Format for importing securities
body: 21 s.maturityDate No Maturity date yyyy-MM-dd. Maturity date of a security.

title: FA Format for importing securities
body: 22 s.maturityPrice No Maturity price Price in the end of the maturity as a number. In most cases 100, if applicable.

title: FA Format for importing securities
body: 23 s.couponFrequency No Coupon frequency Define with a code (before FA 3.1): ANNUALLYSEMI_ANNUALLYQUARTERLYMONTHLY Define with a code: P1D = Daily P1W = Weekly P2W = Every two weeks P4W = Every four weeks P13W = Every 13 weeks P26W = Every 26 weeks P52W = Every 52 weeks P1M = Monthly P2M = Every two months P3M = Every three months P4M = Every four months P6M = Every six months P12M = Annually TERM = Once

title: FA Format for importing securities

title: FA Format for importing securities
body: 49 s.tags No Tags The "Tags" field is a comma-separated list of tags that you can use to categorize your securities. To add a tag: Standalone tags can be added by simply typing the tag name. For example, if you want to add a Fund tag and a New tag, you can add them like this: "Fund,New".Single-select group tags should be added in the format <group name>-<tag name>. For example, if you want to add a tag for an office location in Helsinki, you can add it like this: "office-Helsinki". If a security already has a tag with the same group name, the new tag will replace the old one.Multi-select group tags should be added in the format <group name>:<tag name 1>,<group name>:<tag name 2>, etc. For example, if you want to add tags to your Campaign group, you can add them like this: "Campaign:EarlyBird,Campaign:Friends". If a security already has tags with the same group name, the new tags will be added to the existing ones. To remove a tag, use the syntax "---" followed by the tag name or tag group name. For example: To remove a standalone tag for "Fund", you can use "---Fund".To remove a single-select group tag for "office-Helsinki", you can use "---office-Helsinki".To remove multi-select group tags for "Campaign:EarlyBird" and "Campaign:Friends", you can use "---Campaign:EarlyBird,---Campaign:Friends". For details, see Removing security values with three minuses (---).

E.g. (without spaces) 01.01.2018: exPostSecCostCat1=0.2: exAnteSecCostCat7=1.3:calculationBase=0, 01.01.2019: exPostSecCostCat3=0.3:calculationBase=0 You can use *** syntax to add new observations to the list and keep the existing ones. title: Performance calculation
body: Cashflow timing Description

title: Performance calculation
body: Differentiated (default) The daily market value-based TWR formula Positive net cashflows are added to the base for long positions. Negative cashflows are added to the base only for short positions. In other cases, negative cashflows are handled at the end of the day. The absolute value of the result is taken. DailyTWR=UnrealizedProfit+RealizedProfit+OtherProfits-OtherCosts|MarketValueStart+PositiveNetCashflow|-1DailyTWR=\frac{Unrealized\Pr ofit+Realized\Pr ofit+Other\Pr ofits-OtherCosts}{|MarketValueStart+PositiveNetCashflow|}-1 The daily exposure-based TWR formula Positive net exposure is added to the base for long positions. Negative exposure is added to the base only for short positions. In other cases, negative exposure is handled at the end of the day. The absolute value of the result is taken. DailyTWR=UnrealizedProfit+RealizedProfit+OtherProfits-OtherCosts|ExposureStart+PositiveNetExposure|-1DailyTWR=\frac{Unrealized\Pr ofit+Realized\Pr ofit+Other\Pr ofits-OtherCosts}{|ExposureStart+PositiveNetExposure|}-1

title: Performance calculation
body: Start of day The daily market value-based TWR formula The net of positive and negative net cashflows is added to the base. The absolute value of the result is taken. DailyTWR=UnrealizedProfits+RealizedProfits+OtherProfits-OtherCosts|MarketValueStart+(PositiveNetCashflow-NegativeNetCashflow)|-1DailyTWR=\frac{Unrealized\Pr ofits+Realized\Pr ofits+Other\Pr ofits-OtherCosts}{|MarketValueStart+\left(PositiveNetCashflow-NegativeNetCashflow\right)|}-1 The daily exposure-based TWR formula The net of positive and negative exposure is added to the base. The absolute value of the result is taken. DailyTWR=UnrealizedProfits+RealizedProfits+OtherProfits-OtherCosts|ExposureStart+(PositiveNetExposure-NegativeNetExposure)|-1DailyTWR=\frac{Unrealized\Pr ofits+Realized\Pr ofits+Other\Pr ofits-OtherCosts}{|ExposureStart+\left(PositiveNetExposure-NegativeNetExposure\right)|}-1

title: Performance calculation
body: End of day The daily market value-based TWR formula The net of positive and negative net cashflows are handled at the end of the day. This means they affect the market value base of the next day. The base is always market value start. The absolute value of the result is taken. DailyTWR=UnrealizedProfits+RealizedProfits+OtherProfits-OtherCosts|MarketValueStart|-1DailyTWR=\frac{Unrealized\Pr ofits+Realized\Pr ofits+Other\Pr ofits-OtherCosts}{|MarketValueStart|}-1 The daily exposure-based TWR formula The net of positive and negative exposure is handled at the end of the day. This means it affects the market value base of the next day. The base exposure start. The absolute value of the result is taken. DailyTWR=UnrealizedProfits+RealizedProfits+OtherProfits-OtherCosts|ExposureStart|-1DailyTWR=\frac{Unrealized\Pr ofits+Realized\Pr ofits+Other\Pr ofits-OtherCosts}{|ExposureStart|}-1

title: Performance calculation
body: Simple Dietz The daily market value-based TWR formula Positive and negative net cashflows are handled in the middle of the day. Half of the net of positive and negative net cashflows is added to the base. The absolute value of the result is taken. DailyTWR=UnrealizedProfits+RealizedProfits+otherProfits-otherCosts∣MarketValueStart+PositiveNetCashflow-NegativeNetCashflow2∣-1DailyTWR=\frac{Unrealized\Pr ofits+Realized\Pr ofits+other\Pr ofits-otherCosts}{∣MarketValueStart+\frac{PositiveNetCashflow-NegativeNetCashflow}{2}∣}-1 The daily exposure-based TWR formula Positive and negative net exposure is handled in the middle of the day. Half of the net of positive and negative net exposure is added to the base. The absolute value of the result is taken. DailyTWR=UnrealizedProfits+RealizedProfits+otherProfits-otherCosts∣ExposureStart+PositiveNetExposure-NegativeNetExposure2∣-1DailyTWR=\frac{Unrealized\Pr ofits+Realized\Pr ofits+other\Pr ofits-otherCosts}{∣ExposureStart+\frac{PositiveNetExposure-NegativeNetExposure}{2}∣}-1

title: General
body: Preference Description

title: General
body: Posting generation

title: General
body: Choose the action on transaction saving Option to choose if postings are generated on transaction save: Ask the user if postings should be generated - The system asks you to choose if postings should be generated when you save a transaction.Always generate postings when saving a transaction - The system automatically generates postings every time you save a transaction.Never generate postings when saving a transaction - The system never generates postings when you save a transaction.

title: General
body: Generate zero-amount postings Option to generate postings when the posting amount is zero.

title: General
body: Tag for transactions that generate no postings Tag to apply to transactions to skip the generation of postings.

title: General
body: Posting rules

title: General
body: Generate postings in the portfolio currency Option to use only specific posting rules to generate postings in the portfolio currency. By default, all posting rules are applied to generate postings, and postings are created in the portfolio currency.

title: General
body: Posting rule codes to generate postings in the portfolio currency Posting rules to generate postings in the portfolio currency. Applied to all if empty. Specify the posting rule codes as a comma-separated list. You also need to add the rules to the portfolio in the Portfolio window, Posting rule field.

title: General
body: Generate postings in the security currency Option to generate some postings in the security currency instead of the portfolio currency.

title: General
body: Posting rule codes to generate postings in the security currency Posting rules to generate postings in the security currency. Applied to all if empty. Specify the posting rule codes as a comma-separated list. You also need to add the rules to the portfolio in the Portfolio window, Posting rule field.

title: General
body: Generate postings in the account currency Option to generate some postings in the currency of the security related to the transaction instead of the portfolio currency. Only unique currency postings are generated.

title: General
body: Posting rule codes to generate postings in the account currency Posting rules to generate postings in the account currency. Applied to all if empty. Specify the posting rule codes as a comma-separated list. You also need to add the rules to the portfolio in the Portfolio window, Posting rule field.

title: General
body: Currency codes to generate postings in other currencies Currencies other than the account currency in which postings should be generated. Specify the currency codes as a comma-separated list.

title: General
body: Posting rule codes to generate postings in other currencies Posting rules to generate postings in other currencies. Applied to all if empty. Specify the posting rule codes as a comma-separated list. You also need to add the rules to the portfolio in the Portfolio window, Posting rule field.

title: General
body: Use currency posting rules for security-based transactions with accounts not in the portfolio currency Option to generate separate postings for currency exchange if the security sell or buy is made against an account with a currency different from the portfolio currency. If you enable this option, create posting rules against the currency security type with transaction types buy and sell.

title: General
body: Security type codes that get the purchase value from the cash account purchase price (default: “CASH, FUTCF”) Securities that take the purchase value from the average purchase price of cash in the booked account. This setting is needed if the purchase value and profit are to be booked on cash-type transactions. By default, this is cash (CASH) and future cashflows (FUTCF). Specify the security codes as a comma-separated list.

title: General
body: Posting amount

title: General
body: Use book values for calculating FX profit and loss Option to use the book FX values in currency profit and loss calculation.

title: General
body: Apply rounding before calculating the posting amount Option to round posting charge amounts individually before the total amount is saved for the posting. If you disable this option, rounding is applied to the total posting amount.

title: General
body: Disable the netting of postings Option to disable the netting of postings. Netting means that if a transaction generates multiple postings against the same bookkeeping account for the same date, they are summed up and only one posting is saved. If you disable this option, each posting rule generates a separate posting. As a result, a single transaction can have multiple postings against the same account on the same day.

title: General
body: Bookkeeping accounts

title: General
body: Bookkeeping account numbers per currency to use ACC account postings if the portfolio secondary account number is undefined (for example “SEK=1921,EUR=1922”) Bookkeeping account numbers per currency to use ACC account postings if the portfolio secondary account number is undefined. Format: “Currency code=Account number”. For example, “SEK=1921,EUR=1922”.

title: General

title: Stub convention
body: Convention Description

title: Stub convention
body: None Explicitly states that there are no stubs. This option is used to indicate that the schedule evenly divides by the frequency, leaving no stubs. For example, 6 months can be exactly divided by a 3 month frequency.

title: Stub convention
body: Short initial Any remaining period, shorter than the frequency, will be allocated at the start. For example, 8 months with a 3 month frequency would result in a 2 month initial short stub followed by two periods of 3 months.

title: Stub convention
body: Long initial Any remaining period, shorter than the frequency, will be allocated at the start and combined with the next period, making a total period longer than the standard frequency. For example, 8 months with a 3 month periodic frequency would result in a 5 month initial long stub followed by one period of 3 months.

title: Stub convention
body: Smart initial Any remaining period, shorter than the frequency, will be allocated at the start. If this results in a stub of less than 7 days, the stub will be combined with the next period. If this results in a stub of 7 days or more, the stub will be retained. This is the equivalent of Long initial up to 7 days and Short initial beyond that. This convention appears to match that used by Bloomberg.

title: Stub convention
body: Short final Any remaining period, shorter than the frequency, will be allocated at the end. For example, 8 months with a 3 month frequency would result in two periods of 3 months followed by a 2 month final short stub.

title: Stub convention
body: Long final Any remaining period, shorter than the frequency, will be allocated at the end and combined with the previous period, making a total period longer than the standard frequency. For example, 8 months with a 3 month frequency would result in one period of 3 months followed by a 5 month final long stub.

title: Stub convention
body: Smart final Any remaining period, shorter than the frequency, will be allocated at the end. If this results in a stub of less than 7 days, the stub will be combined with the next period. If this results in a stub of 7 days or more, the stub will be retained. This is the equivalent of Long final up to 7 days and Short final beyond that. This convention appears to match that used by Bloomberg.

title: Stub convention
body: Both Both ends of the schedule have a stub. Days before the first period start date form the initial stub. Days after the last period end date form the final stub.

title: Business day convention
body: Convention Description

title: Business day convention
body: Following (default) Move to the next valid business day.

title: Business day convention
body: Modified following (without crossing month end) Move to the next valid business day, unless that is in the next month in which case move to the previous valid business day.

title: Business day convention
body: Modified following (without crossing mid-month or month end) Move to the next valid business day, unless that is after the 15th of the month OR in the next month in which case move to the previous valid business day.

title: Business day convention
body: Preceding Move to the previous valid business day.

title: Business day convention
body: Modified preceding (without crossing month start) Move to the previous valid business day, unless that is in the previous month in which case move to the next valid business day.

title: Business day convention
body: Nearest For Sunday and Monday, move to the next valid business day, for all other days, move to the previous valid business day.

title: Business day convention
body: No adjustment Make no adjustment.
